meanings.definition: A person who makes a prediction.
meanings.sent1: The predicants at the fair predicted sunny weather for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: The predicants in the story foretold the hero's victory.
meanings.sent3: The predicants in the crystal ball shop had a prediction party.
meanings.sent4: The predicants' words were like a crystal ball, revealing the future.
meanings.sent5: The young predicants practiced predicting the outcomes of their games.

meanings.definition: Something that is predicted or foretold.
meanings.sent1: The storm was one of the predicants of the changing season.
meanings.sent2: The predicants of the fortune teller often came true.
meanings.sent3: The predicants of the magic eight ball were surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent4: The predicants of the ancient prophecy were finally coming to pass.
meanings.sent5: The predicants of the horoscope were eagerly read by many.
